entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Hello everybody,

This website + blog is the result of about three weeks work, working when I don’t have school work. I did not know any html/css/js before I did this, so it was an amazing learning experience.

1. Codecademy

I began by going through the codecademy tutorials to get a brief idea of html/css/js.

2. Twitter-Bootstrap

Afterwards, I looked into the Twitter-Bootstrap and stumbled upon this theme which I liked. So I took that and modified it to display my projects.

3. Google App Engine

Once I had a prototype working, I looked for a website host. Although GAE is not exactly a web hosting platform, it does host static pages quite nicely. I also chose GAE, because I used it before for previous computing projects and it is free!

4. Contact

Next, I wanted a contact system of some sort, and found this. Since I was using Google App Engine to host my website, and GAE has restrictions on sending email, I had to modify it. In the end I wrote a component in Python to send the email.

5. The Blog

I wanted to add a blog of some sort and I found JekyllBootstrap. I thought about hosting my site on Github Pages instead, but that would mean I have to give up on the Contacts page, because Github Pages doesn’t support php. Even if it did support php, I would also have to rewrite the contacts code as it only works for GAE. In the end, I stuck with JekyllBootstrap. I studied their examples and then added my website theme to it. The theme can be found here.

So, this concludes a brief summary of the process I took, from having no experience in web development to creating this website.
